Description: Pottery bowl of Nile silt clay, with round base and incurving walls. The exterior walls are coated with red slip and burnished, the base has been burnished but not slipped. There are the impressions of a reed mat on one side of the base. The interior surface is untreated.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, 'Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna' (London, 1911), 12, pl. xxxi. 7, reproduced as Polished red P7G in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Marked H.30 (c) on base in ink and pencil.
Condition: good, rim chipped, cracked in one place.
